remarks: The first-order Vieta's formula (see ~ http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vieta%27s_formulas ).  If a polynomial of degree ` N ` has ` N ` distinct roots, then the sum over these roots can be calculated as ` -u A ( N - 1 ) / A ( N ) ` .  (If the roots are not distinct, then this formula is still true but must double-count some of the roots according to their multiplicities.)  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Jul-2014.)
